title: All the happenings in the lakes area , Sept . 20 - Oct . 1
body_text:
The Detroit Lakes Tribune accepts community calendar items for publication online and, space permitting, in our Wednesday e-paper and Saturday print edition. Submissions must be made at least a week in advance of the event date, in writing, to either dltribune@dlnewspapers.com or vgerdes@dlnewspapers.com. Each submission must include the date, time and location of event, and where to go for more information (phone, email and/or website). Also include whether the event is free or paid admission, and how much it costs when applicable.
Saturday, September 20
Detroit Lakes Amateur Radio Club: The monthly meeting of the Detroit Lakes Amateur Radio Club will take place in the Ice House Restaurant at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, starting at 9 a.m. An informative presentation will conclude the gathering. Virtual meeting options are available. Visit the website at www.w0emz.org for more information.
ADVERTISEMENT
Taste of Lund: Lund Lutheran Church in rural Detroit Lakes will be hosting its 20th Annual Taste of Lund festival starting at 9 a.m. Enjoy Scandinavian delicacies including rommegrot, sandbakkels, Swedish almond cake, rosettes, krumkake, jula kaka, flatbrød, kransekake, fruit soup, rice pudding, Swedish cream, lefse, crepes, kringels, fattigmann, lutefisk, Vestlands lefse, sandwiches and beverages. Tickets to sample are three for $4, and there will also be a quilt and bake sale. The church is located nine miles north of Detroit Lakes on Richwood Road. Call 218-847-9662 for more information.
Applefest 2025: The Gottenborg Apple Orchard will host Applefest from 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m. at 20074 Audubon Lake Road, Audubon. There will be food served from 11 a.m.-2 p.m., and live music from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Fresh pressed apple cider will be available throughout the day, and attendees can even take a gallon of it home, free of charge. You can also come pick your own apples; Sweet Sixteen, Haralson and Sweet Tango varieties will be on hand (some pre-picked options are also available). All are welcome.
Sasquatch Trail Run/Last Man Standing: Detroit Mountain Recreation Area is bringing back its Sasquatch Trail Run, starting at 10 a.m. A 4-mile trail loop will be set up for competitors to take a run at the title, and this year, there's a twist — competitors can continue to do one loop of the trail every hour, on the hour, until they are the Last Man Standing. Learn more and sign up to participate online at project412mn.org.
Plants and Prizes: Laker Prep Early Childhood Center of Detroit Lakes is partnering with the Detroit Lakes Noon Rotary Club and Lakeside Tavern to present the 2nd Annual Plants and Prizes fundraiser. There will be a plant sale at Lakeside Tavern and Brewery, 200 West Lake Drive, from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Perennials, succulents and house plants will be included, and both events will also have a Rooting for Kids prize board where each ticket sold gives participants a 1 in 10 chance of winning cash and other prizes. Laker Prep is a 501(c)3 nonprofit.
Detroit Lakes Oktoberfest: The Detroit Lakes Noon Rotary Club will be presenting its 3rd Annual Oktoberfest celebration at Zorbaz and nearby Peoples Park in Detroit Lakes (new location this year). Peoples Street in between the park and Zorbaz will be shut down to traffic from 11 a.m.-5 p.m. The festivities officially get underway at noon with the tapping of the first keg of beer by Mayor Matt Brenk. Entrance fees are $20 for all ages 21 and up, $10 for all ages 13 and up, and free for all ages 12 and under. Your entry fee includes a complimentary stein and one beverage of choice. Visit oktoberfestdl.com for tickets and more information, including a full schedule of events, from yodeling and stein holding contests to the coronation of Mr. and Mrs. Oktoberfest.
Back Roads Studio Art Crawl: The 3rd Annual Back Roads Studio Art Crawl will be held from 10 a.m.-5 p.m., with 14 artists in 10 locations around the Vergas area participating. There will be a door prize drawing at each location. The Back Roads Studio Art Crawl is sponsored by the Vergas Arts Club, in conjunction with the Vergas Community Club. Go to facebook.com/vergascommunityclub or the website at vergascommunityclub.com for further information.
"Is This Magic?" Experimental Dance Performance: Performing artist Kayla Schiltgen will be presenting her experimental dance performance, "Is This Magic?" at Summit Dance School, 714 Lake Ave., Suite 201, Detroit Lakes. The day starts 10 a.m. with a free dance workshop, followed by a public performance at 7 p.m. Come to the workshop (intended for ages 14 and up) and explore personal expression through movement activities that Schiltgen has used to create her original dance work, then stay for light snacks and conversation. The evening performance will be followed by an artist talk. Open to the public; all ages, body types and dance experience (or lack thereof) welcome. Suggested donation of $10 per person for the evening performance, payable at the door.
ADVERTISEMENT
The Great North Star Read Together: Minnesotans are invited to gather at participating libraries across the state to show support for libraries and the vital role they play in our communities, creating a statewide show of appreciation. The Detroit Lakes "read out" event will take place from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. on the lawn outside the library at 1000 Washington Ave. (Event will move indoors in case of bad weather). Participants are asked to bring their own lawn chair or blanket, as outdoor seating is limited.
Eagles Tattoo Fundraiser: Detroit Lakes Eagles Aerie 2342 will host a tattoo fundraiser at the Eagles Club, 112 W. Holmes St., Detroit Lakes, from 5-11 p.m. Bryniarski Tattoo will be offering flash sheets for $100; appointments are walk-in only. No reservations. Proceeds will support the Eagles' kitchen remodel and kids' Christmas shopping event. Call 218-847-5267 for more information.
Cormorant Fall Stag: The Cormorant Lakes Sportsman's Club will host its fall stag at 18587 Sportsmen Road, Audubon, starting at 6 p.m.
Free Community Square Dance: The Lakes Area Community Square Dance Association will host its final old-time music jam and community square dance of the season in the Cormorant Community Center, 10929 Co Hwy 5, Pelican Rapids, from 5:30-8:30 p.m. The festivities start off with an open music jam at 5:30 p.m. that is open to all area acoustic musicians, followed by square dancing for all ages and skill levels, starting at 6:30 p.m. John Heine will be the caller. Please wear comfortable clothing and shoes. All are welcome.
Live Music: Chloe Raye at the Gottenborg Apple Orchard, Audubon, 11 a.m.-2 p.m. (for Applefest); Rachael Ianiro at the Cormorant Pub Boathouse in Cormorant, 7-10 p.m.; Brianna Helbling at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon, 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Rick Adams at The Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8-11 p.m.; Karaoke with Kelly at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn Beach Bar, 9 p.m.-midnight.
Sunday, September 21
Color Guard Fundraiser Breakfast: The Lake Region Veterans Color Guard will be hosting a breakfast fundraiser from 8 a.m.-12 p.m. at the American Legion Club, 810 West Lake Drive, Detroit Lakes. Suggested minimum donation is $9 for a meal including scrambled eggs; pancakes or French toast; sausage or bacon; and coffee or orange juice. All are welcome.
Cribbage Tournament: Bucks Mill Brewing of Detroit Lakes will host a cribbage tournament at 824 Washington Ave., starting at 1 p.m. Cost is $10 per person, with registration opening at 12:30 p.m.; tournament format is double elimination, or a 3-game guarantee bracket depending on the number of entries. Prizes will be awarded to the teams who finish in first, second and third place.
ADVERTISEMENT
Pinball Tournament: Bucks Mill Brewing of Detroit Lakes will host a pinball tournament at 824 Washington Ave., starting at 1 p.m. Cost is $15 per person, with registration opening at 12:30 p.m.; the number of openings available is limited, so plan accordingly.
Zorbaz Bingo: It's Zunday Fun Day at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, which will be hosting live bingo every Sunday this fall and winter (weather and holidays permitting), starting tonight at 5 p.m. Proceeds will benefit Detroit Lakes Youth Hockey. Must be at least 18 years old to play.
Monday, September 22
Tech Time-Chat GPT Basics: Join the members of the Detroit Lakes Community and Cultural Center's Engage group at the Holmes Art Cellar, 801 Oak Grove Ave., Detroit Lakes (basement of the Holmes Theatre), for a free "Tech Time with Teri" presentation on the basics of Chat GPT, starting at noon. This presentation by Engage coordinator Teri Holehouse is being offered free of charge. Call 218-844-4221 or visit dlccc.org/engage for more information.
Anime and Manga Club: Anime and manga fans are invited to geek out over their favorite shows and stories, starting at 4 p.m. at the Detroit Lakes Public Library. This month the club will be making manga-inspired bookmarks out of recycled books. Open to all young adults age 13 and up who are interested in joining. No cost to attend.
Sacred Heart Cares Ladies Night: The congregation of Sacred Heart Catholic Church will host a Ladies Night in the church parking lot at 202 West Maple Ave., Frazee, with food from the Taqueria Escobar food truck, drinks, games and dessert. The food truck will be open to the public from 3-5:30 p.m., and for the ladies of Sacred Heart only from 5:30-6:30 p.m. (Meals are complimentary for church members).
Tuesday, September 23
Lunch & Learn-Hip and Knee Joint Health: Join the members of the Detroit Lakes Community and Cultural Center's Engage group at the Holmes Art Cellar, 801 Oak Grove Ave., Detroit Lakes (basement of the Holmes Theatre), for a free "Lunch and Learn" presentation on hip and knee joint health with Dr. Wes Anderson, starting at 11 a.m. There is no cost to attend, but please pre-register by calling 218-844-4221 no later than Friday, Sept. 19 if planning to stay for lunch.
Robotics in Healthcare: The Detroit Lakes Library Club will be hosting a special presentation, "Robotics in Healthcare," from 2-3 p.m. at the Detroit Lakes Public Library, 1000 Washington Ave. Local physicians and a long-term care administrator will share how robots facilitate surgical procedures and help address workforce shortages. Free and open to the public. Come early and enjoy some refreshments.
ADVERTISEMENT
Wednesday, September 24
Car Seat Checkup: St. Mary's EMS and Safe Kids Grand Forks will host a free car seat checkup at 225 Park St., Detroit Lakes, from 3-6 p.m. A certified child passenger safety technician will be checking car seats for correct installation, free of charge. This event is open to the public, with no appointments necessary. All are welcome.
Open Acoustic Jam: Bring your acoustic instruments to the Detroit Lakes Public Library for an unplugged jam session, starting at 5 p.m. All experience levels are welcome to this supportive and family-friendly event. Free and open to the public. Bring your acoustic instrument and come have some fun!
DLUMC Meatball Supper: The congregation of Detroit Lakes United Methodist Church will host its annual meatball supper at 885 Pembina Trail, Detroit Lakes. Menu includes two meatballs, mashed potatoes and gravy, a roll, green beans, coleslaw and dessert. This year's supper is "to go" only, with meals available for pickup from 4:30-7 p.m. Cost is $15 per plate; cash, checks and credit cards all accepted.
Pinot for Paws: The Humane Society of the Lakes will be hosting a special "Pinot for Paws" fundraiser at Spanky's Stone Hearth, 34785 Co. Hwy. 4, Vergas, starting with a social at 5:30 p.m. Tickets are $100 per person, or $180 per couple, and include a four-course dinner, with wine pairings, which starts at 6 p.m. Sign up online at givebutter.com/FLEsbF to reserve your spot, as space is limited.
Pizzas, Puzzles and Pitchers: Lake Park Liquors, located at 902 U.S. Hwy. 10 in Lake Park, will host a puzzle competition starting at 7 p.m. Cost is $80 per team (up to four people); each registered team will receive a pizza and pitcher of beer along with their 500-piece puzzle. Prizes will be awarded. Call 218-238-5888 for more information.
Thursday, September 25
DAC Community Celebration: The Becker County DAC will host a special community celebration in the Detroit Lakes City Park, 1355 Washington Ave., from 5:30-7:30 p.m. There will be music, a photo booth, bouncy houses, food, a beer garden, and free desserts; water will also be available free of charge. All are welcome.
Charitable Pint Night-Ruff Revival: Bucks Mill Brewing will host a Charitable Pint Night from 5-8 p.m. at 824 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes. A portion of the proceeds from every pint sold during the event will benefit Ruff Revival, a local charitable organization that seeks to enhance the mental health and well-being of first responders and first line medical personnel by promoting emotional resilience through rescue dog animal assisted therapy, collaboration with mental health professionals and advocacy. All are welcome.
ADVERTISEMENT
Square Dancing: Join the Wadena Whirlaways at St. Michael's Catholic Church in Motley for a square dance from 7-9:30 p.m. Phil Miller is the caller, and "Western Cowboy" is the theme. Call 612-743-3480 for more information.
Friday, September 26
Live Music: Dan Brekke at Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30-9:30 p.m.
Saturday, September 27
Lake Park Pumpkin Fest: The community of Lake Park will host its annual Pumpkin Fest celebration from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. Festivities include a Harvest Breakfast at the American Legion from 7-10 a.m.; 5K trail walk/fun run starting at 9 a.m. in front of the fire hall (registration opens at 8 a.m.); a Pumpkin Bake-Off at the fire hall from 9-10:30 a.m.; a car show on Main Street from 9 a.m.-2 p.m.; a craft and vendor show from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. at Lake Park-Audubon High School; a chalk drawing competition at the basketball court from 10-11 a.m., with judging at 11:30 a.m.; a parade through downtown Lake Park at 3 p.m. (lineup starts at 2:30 p.m.); a Fireman's Feed at the fire hall immediately following the parade; and karaoke at Lake Park Liquors starting at 8:30 p.m. There will also be kids games, mechanical bull rides, pumpkin carving and cleaning, chainsaw carving demonstrations, a pie walk, junior fireman's obstacle course, wagon rides, food vendors and more.
Pine Needle Basket Making: The Becker County Museum will host a workshop on making pine needle baskets from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. at 714 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes. Learn how to craft a traditional coiled basket from locally harvested pine needles, built on a leather base. No previous basket weaving experience is necessary. Cost is $27 for museum members, $30 for nonmenbers, with all materials provided; lunch is not included, so please plan on bringing your own. Sign up online at beckercountyhistory.org/store to reserve your spot, as space is limited.
Comedy Night: Bucks Mill Brewing will host a Comedy Night at 7 p.m., featuring comedians Nathan Fulsbakke, Jenny Lou Russi and Tim Jones. Tickets are available for $20 each in the taproom at 824 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes.
Live Music: Elijah O'Sullivan at the Cormorant Pub Boathouse in Cormorant, 7-10 p.m.; David Lee at The Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8-11 p.m.; Smokin' Amp Karaoke at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon, 8-11 p.m.; Martin Drive at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.
Sunday, September 28
Viking Football Buffet: VFW Post 1676 of Detroit Lakes will host a breakfast buffet in honor of the Minnesota Vikings taking on the Pittsburgh Steelers in Dublin, Ireland. Doors open at 8 a.m., with serving to start at 8:30 a.m. (which is also the scheduled kickoff time) and continue until the end of the third quarter. Cost is $10.95 for adults, $7.95 for kids age 3-10, and free for kids age 2 and under (must be accompanied by a parent). There will also be a Bloody Mary bar available for an additional cost. The VFW Club is located at 500 North Washington in Detroit Lakes. All are welcome.
ADVERTISEMENT
Viking Football Breakfast: Breakfast will be served at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store, 445 Main St., Audubon, starting at 8 a.m., and they will also be showing the Vikings overseas football game in Dublin, which starts at 8:30 a.m. All are welcome.
Tamarac Fall Festival: The Friends of Tamarac National Wildlife Refuge will host their annual Fall Festival from 12-4 p.m. There will be traditional wild rice processing demonstrations by harvesters from White Earth; wild rice tasting; compass migrateering and bird song hikes; presentations with Ojibwe author Travis Zimmerman, who will read from his book "How the Birds Got Their Songs," will be held at both 1 and 3 p.m. (he will also sign copies of his book in between sessions); and crafts and activities for kids of all ages. For more information, please call 218-220-5507 or 218-570-9162.
Monday, September 29
Genealogy Work Session: The Detroit Lakes Public Library offers free access to a number of popular genealogy research tools, including Ancestry and FamilySearch. If you're interested in exploring these tools with a little assistance, then sign up for this 1 p.m. work session, which will allow you to access these tools with a library staff member on hand to answer questions as they come up. This two-hour program is being offered free of charge, but registration is required. Stop by the library at 1000 Washington Ave., call 218-847-2168 or go online to larl.org/events to reserve your spot. Be sure to bring along whatever family information you have as a starting point for your research.
Pixel Art Painting: Turn your favorite video game style into a pixelated masterpiece in this fun, free workshop hosted by the Detroit Lakes Public Library, 1000 Washington Ave., from 4:30-6 p.m. Choose from sample ideas or make your own plan. Fill in building blocks with colored paints and end up with fun, low-res art to take home with you. No cost to participate, but please pre-register by stopping by the library, calling 218-847-2168 or going online to larl.org/events to reserve your spot.
Tuesday, September 30
All Abilities Storytime: The Detroit Lakes Public Library will offer a neurodiversity-friendly and inclusive storytime session at 10:30 a.m. Storytime includes lively read-alouds, sing-alongs, and opportunities for creative expression, tailored to meet diverse needs, and is geared toward children of all abilities between ages 3-6, but anyone is welcome to join this fun, supportive environment where every child can thrive. Each session will feature stories on a specific theme – this month's theme is "opposites."
Town Hall Legislative Update: All area residents are welcome to join Minnesota Senator Paul Utke (Senate District 5), Rep. Krista Knudsen (House District 5A) and Rep. Mike Wiener (House District 5B) at The Outpost in Huntersville. 23115 Old Bridge Road, Menahga, at 6 p.m. for a legislative update and town hall meeting.
Wednesday, October 1
Writers Group: Writers and aspiring writers seeking encouragement, feedback and collaboration are welcome to join the Detroit Lakes Public Library's Writers' Group, which meets at the library at 3 p.m. All writing genres are welcome. If you have any questions, send an email to detroit@larl.org or call 218-847-2168.
Multi-day and Recurring Events
Perham Rotary Blood Drive: The Perham Rotary Club is hosting a two-day blood drive for Vitalant at the Perham Area Community Center on Tuesday and Wednesday, Sept. 23-24. Appointments are available between 12:30-6 p.m. on Tuesday and 7:30 a.m.-noon on Wednesday. Donors during the month of September have a chance to win a $10,000 gift card from Vitalant. Sign up online at donors.vitalant.org (use the blood drive code PERHAM) or call 877-25-VITAL to reserve your spot.
Plant, Pest and Gardening Clinics: To help answer your questions about trees, shrubs, home gardens and lawns, the Becker County Master Gardeners will host a free plant, pest and gardening clinic every Wednesday through Sept. 24, 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at the University of Minnesota Extension office, 1120 8th St. SE, Detroit Lakes. There is no charge for a consultation, though participants are asked to bring samples for easier identification of plants, insects and diseases. For more information, including the specific type of samples you might need to bring, call the Extension office at 218-846-7328, ext. 7105.
Electronics Recycling: The Becker County Transfer Station at 24413 Co. Rd. 144, Detroit Lakes, will be hosting free electronics recycling on Oct. 1-4. Drop off your old, non-functioning/unwanted computer towers, laptops and tablets (including iPads), printers, cell phones, monitors and televisions to the transfer station anytime between 8 a.m.-4:30 p.m. Wednesday through Friday, Oct. 1-3, or between 8 a.m.-noon on Saturday, Oct. 4. For those living outside the Detroit Lakes area, the satellite transfer station at 23330 Co. Hwy. 47, Osage, will host an electronics recycling day on Saturday, Oct. 4 only, from 9 a.m.-1 p.m. There is a per-person limit of five each on monitors, TVs and laptops brought in for recycling.
Pressure Canner Gauge Testing: The University of Minnesota Extension Service in Becker County is equipped to test pressure canner dial gauges for home canners, using a pump dial gauge-testing unit. This unit uses air rather than steam pressure to test pressure canner gauges. Please call Linda Perrine, Extension Office Manager at 218-846-7328 to make an appointment to have your gauge tested free of charge. The Extension Office is located at 1120 8th St. SE, Detroit Lakes. For general home canning questions, contact the University of Minnesota AnswerLine toll-free at 1-800-854-1678. Calls are answered Monday-Friday between 9 a.m.-noon and 1-4 p.m.
Shady Hollow Flea Market: The Shady Hollow Flea Market, located south of Detroit Lakes, will be open every Saturday through the end of September, from 8 a.m.-3 p.m. (gates open at 6 a.m. for vendors and early-bird pickers). The site offers dozens of amazing vendors, including food and beverages. Visit shadyhollowfleamarket.com for more information.
Lakes Area Farmers Market: The Lakes Area Farmers Market will be open every Tuesday and Saturday through October in Detroit Lakes' Peoples Park (just north of Zorbaz), from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. each day. Besides fresh produce, local vendors will be offering fresh-baked bread and handcrafted candies, specialty lemonades and more. Visit lakesareafarmersmarket.info or call 218-230-9822 for more information; many new and favorite vendors are also featured on their Facebook page.
Tinker Tots: Parents with kids between the ages of 1-5 are invited to bring them to the Becker County Museum, 714 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. every Thursday for a STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math)-themed activity designed just for them. Though there is no cost for the event, regular museum admission applies (free for museum members; $10 adults, $5 kids age 1 and up for nonmembers).
Cribbage Players Wanted: The Richville Community Center will host open cribbage play on Thursdays from 1-3 p.m. Both new and experienced players are welcome. Can play two-hand, three-hand and four-hand. Cost is $2 per person; there will be prize money. The community center is located at 100 Grove St. SW in Richville. Call Carolyn at 218-758-2162 if interested in joining, or for more information.
Grace Cafe: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be serving lunch every Wednesday from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Menu varies from week to week. The lunch is open to all in the Detroit Lakes area; admission is a free-will donation.
Grace Food Pantry: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be operating a food pantry during its regular office hours, 9 a.m.- noon, Monday through Friday. Anyone in need can come in and pick up some food. Donations will also be accepted.
Coffee Club: David-Donehower Funeral Home hosts a monthly Coffee Club in the community room at the Detroit Lakes Police Department (106 E. Holmes St.) on the third Tuesday of every month, starting at 10 a.m. Learn how intentional planning of your final wishes and setting funds aside today, will protect your loved ones in the future. Anna Schmitz from Edward Jones will also lead a relaxed, informal discussion on current events, the economy and investing. Plus, the coffee's on us! Free and open to the public.
GED/Adult Diploma Instruction: If one of your “life happens” moments resulted in not finishing high school, Lakes Area Adult Education is ready to help you complete that process with a GED or an Adult Diploma. Orientation sessions take place twice a month, so get in touch and get started now! Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us. Please note that the Adult Education office at M State has been moved to Room F-114 (use the east side entrance).
Free ESL Instruction: Free English as a Second Language instruction for adults is offered at Lakes Area Adult Education. The schedule is flexible and individualized. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information. Please note that the Adult Education office at M State has been moved to Room F-114 (use the east side entrance).
Food Production Manager Certification: Lakes Area Adult Education offers SERVSAFE classes twice a year for those needing state-certified food protection manager certification or re-certification; additional classes may be scheduled to fit your needs (for six or more participants). Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information.
Driver's License Written Exam Prep: Lakes Area Adult Education offers virtual classes for Minnesota Driver's License written exam preparation every fall and spring. These classes help unlicensed adult drivers to become familiar with vocabulary, signs, and rules of the road that will assist them in passing the written portion of the MN Driver’s License Exam. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information.
Heart O'Lakes Harmony: The Heart O'Lakes Harmony men's barbershop-style a cappella choral group is looking for new members. Anyone who enjoys singing is welcome to come join their weekly practices, every Monday at 7 p.m. in Faith Lutheran Church, 423 S. Broadway, Pelican Rapids (located across the street from the high school). For more information, please contact Harlan Hoff at 701-306-8976.
TOPS Meeting: The local chapter of Take Off Pounds Sensibly (TOPS) meets weekly on Thursday mornings at Trinity Lutheran Church, 1401 Madison Ave., Detroit Lakes. Weigh-in begins at 8:20 a.m., meeting at 9 a.m. Contact Carol at 218-841-0226 or Coleen at 218-841-2877 for more information. All are welcome; first session is free.
Library Storytime: The Detroit Lakes Public Library offers weekly Preschool Storytime sessions every Thursday at 10:30 a.m. Preschoolers and their caregivers/families are invited to join library staff for stories, flannel boards, finger plays, songs and more. This early literacy experience explores a different theme each week and is a way to encourage young children to enjoy reading. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Celebrate Recovery: The Celebrate Recovery group meets every Tuesday, 6:30-8 p.m. at Christian Fellowship Church, 28048 Meadow Drive, Detroit Lakes, to take the next steps on the "Road to Recovery: Eight Principles Based on the Beatitudes, Twelve Steps and their Biblical Comparison." Many struggle with alcoholism, divorce, sexual abuse, codependency, domestic violence, drug addiction, food and gambling addictions. Celebrate Recovery is a tried and proven format to help you walk through life's struggles. Men and women meet in a large group format, then break off into smaller discussion groups; men with men, women with women. Come as you are. No cost. We are here to help. Unfortunately, no childcare is available at this time. For more information, check out the website at celebraterecovery.com or call us at 218-234-2496.
Caring Cup Grief Support: The Caring Cup, a gathering of community members who are dealing with the loss of a loved one, will meet at the David-Donehower Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on the second Wednesday of every month; the Furey Funeral Home in Frazee on every third Wednesday, and West-Kjos Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on every fourth Wednesday. All meetings take place from 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. and offer a relaxed time to face the challenges of life after loss, together. For more information, call Mary Swenson at 218-847-4147.
Trivia Nights: Detroit Lakes' Lakeside Tavern hosts a Trivia Night every Monday from 7 to 9 p.m. in its upstairs space; and both Bucks Mill Brewing and the Holiday Inn host Trivia Mafia every Wednesday night, starting at 6 p.m. in the Holiday Inn and 7 p.m. at Bucks Mill. Lakeside is located at 200 West Lake Drive, while Bucks Mill Brewing is located at 824 Washington Ave. in downtown Detroit Lakes and the Holiday Inn is at 1155 U.S. Hwy. 10, Detroit Lakes.
DL Cloggers: The DL Cloggers meet to dance and socialize every Tuesday (excluding holidays) at 1 p.m. in the basement of Detroit Lakes VFW Post 1676. No prior dance experience is necessary. For more information, call Ruby at 218-847-7741.
HR Connect: The Detroit Lakes Chamber is hosting an opportunity for human resources professionals, business owners and managers to connect, every first Thursday of the month at 8:15 a.m. at the Chamber office at 700 Summit Ave. Discuss human resource topics, share best practices and review data to help attract, retain and grow the workforce for the lakes region. The event is free for Chamber members, $10 for non-members.
Baby Bounce: Songs, stories, and action poems for infants, toddlers and their caregivers are offered every Monday at the Detroit Lakes Public Library at 10:30 a.m. The program runs about a half-hour, including playtime and chatting with other caregivers. For ages 0-18 months. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Alcoholics Anonymous: Detroit Lakes' Alano Club meets at 827 Summit Ave. on the following days and times: Sundays at 1 p.m., 12x12 open meeting; Tuesdays at 7 p.m., Big Book open meeting; Wednesdays at noon, Grapevine open meeting; Wednesdays at 6 p.m., women's open meeting; Thursdays at 7 p.m., Intro to AA open meeting; Saturdays at 7 a.m., men's open meeting; Saturdays at 9 a.m., Women's Big Book closed meeting; Saturdays at 8 p.m., open topic meeting. There are no dues or fees for meetings. For more information, call 218-844-9970 or the District 3 AA Helpline at 877-833-2327.
Holy Rosary Al-Anon Meeting: There will be an Al-Anon meeting every Thursday, starting at noon, inside Holy Rosary Catholic Church, 1043 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes. There is also an Al-Anon meeting at 7 p.m. every Tuesday at the Alano Club at 827 Summit Ave. in Detroit Lakes.
Overeaters Anonymous: A 12-step program for those who struggle in their relationship with food, Overeaters Anonymous continues to meet at noon every Tuesday at Holy Rosary Catholic Church in Detroit Lakes. There is no charge to attend. Contact Debbie C. at 218-234-3071. Another group also meets on Sunday nights at 6 p.m. via Zoom. This is a change of venue as of Oct. 9. Please call Sharon R. at 1-701-388-7585 or Hailee S. at 1-701-212-7904 for information if you plan to join the Zoom meeting. There is no charge to participate.
Compiled by Vicki Gerdes for the Detroit Lakes Tribune.
